Name: Peter
Quote: "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God." Matt. 16:16
Context/Controversies: Transition from Jewish Christianity to Gentile inclusion, leadership in the church, Torah observances for Gentile believers (Acts 10-15)
Opponents: Pharisees, Judaizers in the Church, Romans
Most Well Known For: Being a chief disciple of Jesus, Opening the Church to Gentiles, Apostleship

Name: Paul
Nickname: The Apostle Paul; Saul of Tarsus
Most Well Known For: Epistles in NT; Missionary work throughout Turkey, Greece, Italy

Name: John the Apostle
Nickname: Son of Zebedee; Son of Thunder; Beloved Disciple
Quote: “That which we have seen and heard we proclaim also to you.” (1 John 1:3)
Context/Controversies: Transition to post-apostolic church; Early Christological disputes

Name: Stephen
Strengths/Weaknesses: Full of grace and power; Bold defense

Name: Philip the Evangelist
Quote: “Do you understand what you are reading?” (Acts 8:30)
Most Well Known For: Ethiopian Eunuch; Simon Magician; Prophesying daughters

Name: Clement of Rome
Quote: “Let us fix our eyes on the blood of Christ…” (1 Clem. 7)
Context/Controversies: Post-apostolic transition; Corinthian presbyter dispute; Early church order; Roman–Corinthian relationship
Other Info: Fourth bishop of Rome; Possibly Phil. 4:3

Name: Hermas
Quote: “Put away from yourself all double-mindedness…” (Shepherd, Mandate 9)
Context/Controversies: Post-apostolic moral concerns; Repentance after baptism; Ethical rigor; Moralism concerns

Name: Ignatius of Antioch
Writings: Seven letters (Ephesians, Magnesians, Trallians, Romans, Philadelphians, Smyrnaeans, Polycarp)
Context/Controversies: Church unity; Episcopal authority; Incarnation debates
Strengths/Weaknesses: Strong Christology; Courage; Later debate over episcopacy

Name: Polycarp
Quote: “Eighty and six years have I served Him…”
Most Well Known For: Early martyr account; Link to Apostle John

Name: Didache
Context/Controversies: Church order; Baptism; Eucharist; Two Ways theology

Name: Hermas (duplicate entry?)
Other Info: Likely same as Hermas of Rome

Name: Justin Martyr
Writings: Dialogue with Trypho; First Apology; Second Apology
Context/Controversies: Defense of Christianity to pagans and Jews

Name: Irenaeus
Writings: Against Heresies; Demonstration of Apostolic Preaching

Name: Tertullian
Quote: “The blood of the martyrs is the seed of the church.”

Name: Cyprian of Carthage
Writings: The Lapsed; On the Unity of the Church

Name: Origen of Alexandria
Strengths/Weaknesses: Brilliant yet speculative; Later condemned views

Name: Lactantius
Writings: Divine Institutes; Deaths of the Persecutors

Name: Hippolytus
Writings: Refutation of All Heresies; Apostolic Tradition

Name: Diocletian
Other Info: Four administrations: Maximian (West), Constantius (Rhine), Galerius (Danube), Diocletian (East)

Name: Constantine
Most Well Known For: Tolerating Christianity in the Roman Empire

Name: Pelagius
Most Well Known For: Arguments with Augustine on sin and salvation

Name: John Cassian
Most Well Known For: Cooperative grace; revision of Augustine vs. Pelagius

Name: Theodosius II
Other Info: Called Second Council of Ephesus; sided with Eutyches

Name: Justinian I
Other Info: Built Hagia Sophia; defeated Vandals & Ostrogoths; empire weakened by plague

Name: Gregory of Nyssa
Writings: On the Holy Trinity, On Not Three Gods

Name: Donatus
Nickname: Donatus the Great; Bishop of Carthage

Name: Maximus the Confessor
Other Info: Tortured; vindicated at Third Constantinople Council

Name: Simeon the Stylite
Most Well Known For: Perching on pillars to pray; Pillar saints

Name: Martin of Tours
Most Well Known For: Gave half his cloak to a beggar; defended Nicene Christianity among Arian Goths

Name: Ufilas
Other Info: Devised Gothic alphabet; translated Bible (“Silver Bible”)

Name: Gregory of Tours
Other Info: Recorded conversion of Franks; rise of Merovingian Dynasty and Clovis I

Name: Patrick of Ireland
Quote: “I am a slave in Christ to an outlandish nation because of the unspeakable glory of the eternal life which is in Jesus Christ our Lord.”
Other Info: Former slave who returned to evangelize Ireland

Name: Pope Gregory I
Writings: Moralia, Regula Pastoralis, Dialogues, Book of Pastoral Rule
Other Info: Assumed civil leadership when Roman structures weakened
Most Well Known For: Strengthened papacy; ecclesiology; purgatory; ritual development
Strengths/Weaknesses: Strong administrator; less scholarly than Augustine

Name: The Carolingians
Most Well Known For: Consolidation of Western Europe; alliance with papacy

Name: The Merovingians
Most Well Known For: Foundation of Frankish rule before Carolingians

Name: Charles Martel
Most Well Known For: Victory at Battle of Tours; military consolidation

Name: Pepin III (the Short)
Other Info: Crowned by Pope Stephen II; Donation of Pepin

Name: Charlemagne
Opponents: Lombards (Desiderius); Muslims (Iberia); Avars; Slavs; Saxons; Danes
Other Info: Crowned Emperor (800 AD); biography by Einhard

Name: Vikings
Other Info: Norwegians → Britain; Danes → Central Europe; Swedes → Russia

Name: Nicholas I
Context/Controversies: Constantinople interference; marital dispute of Lothair II

Name: Pope Boniface VIII
Most Well Known For: Assertion of papal authority over monarchs

Name: John of Damascus
Nickname: The Last of the Church Fathers

Name: Paschasius Radbertus
Writings: On the Body and the Blood of the Lord (831)

Name: Gottschalk
Opponents: Louis the Pious; Hrabanus Maurus; Hincmar
Other Info: Debate involving Ratramnus; Charles the Bald
